page.title: 09LOCAL TRANSPORT FACILITIES
page.content: On account of its rural nature, the area is not particularly well served by{public transport}and a car is almost a necessity. There is a limited daily bus service from Cirencester to Swindon, which passes through Fairford, run by Stroud Valley Coach Co. but National Coaches travelling to London can only be picked up at these places. A local coach firm provides a service for shoppers from the surrounding villages and there is a community minibus that can be hired, but its future is in doubt. Mopeds are very popular with young people of l6 and over to allow them to get around more easily. Today there is no railway but Fairford was once linked by rail to Oxford. The line opened in l873, closed on June l8th l962 despite local opposition.
